content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    code_blocks = split(md, r"```jl\n?*(.*?)\n```\n"))[2:end]
    
    cleaned_code = []
    for block in code_blocks
        # Remove code fences and newlines
        processed_block = replace(block, "^```jl", "")
                                              .replace("```jl$", "")
                                              .split("\n")
        cleaned_code.append(processed_block)
    end

    joined_code = join(cleaned_code, "\n\n")
end
```
The function `extract_julia_code` takes a Markdown string `md` as input. It extracts all code blocks in Julia language, removes the code fences and joins the code blocks together with newlines.

To use this function, you can pass your markdown document's content to it:

```julia
md_content = """
```jl
# Example Code Block
println("Hello, World!")
```

Another code block:

```jl
function add(a, b)
    a + b
end
```
"""

extracted_code = extract_julia_code(md_content)
println(extracted_code)
```
